trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_000<tab>Come again? A sin eater fused with a voidsent?
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_001<tab>...We should speak elsewhere. Somewhere quiet.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_002<tab>Tell me. You were investigating a ruined church of the First Light?
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_003<tab>You possess a singular talent for dredging up memories I'd sooner forget.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_004<tab>...Not that I can fault you for it. Remembrance is the burden of the living.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_005<tab>What you described sounds like a voidsent I once defeated in the Thirteenth. Back before...any of this.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_006<tab>At the time, I was just another memoriate, traveling the land and hunting the monsters that preyed upon the innocent.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_007<tab>...Until I realized one such monster could be of use to me.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_008<tab>When I sealed it in memoria, I had no other thought but preventing its resuscitation.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_009<tab>But when I agreed to journey to the First as the Ascians' hidden emissary, I remembered that voidsent.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_010<tab>A creature of its caliber could turn the tide of battle. It could lend me the strength I needed to prevail.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_011<tab>Drawing its power from the memoria would have been a simple matter.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_012<tab>Yet after bringing it here, I left it to gather dust upon my desk in Lakeland.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_013<tab>If I truly had wanted to defeat Ardbert, that voidsent would have been my solution...
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_014<tab>But I was afraid. Afraid of being twisted by Darkness like so many memoriates before me. Afraid of becoming what I hated the most.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_015<tab>Never mind that it was far too late. The Ascians' puppet, fearing corruption... Absurd, don't you think?
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_Q1_000_016<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_A1_000_017<tab>You're no monster, Cyella.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_A1_000_018<tab>Part of you always wanted Ardbert to succeed?
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_020<tab>You are kind to say so.

TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_021<tab>Succeed in slaying the monster, you mean? I wish I had. Would that I'd been a traitor only to myself─I could've believed my heart was in the right place, if nothing else.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_022<tab>Absurd, yet in no way amusing. I agree.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_023<tab>Above all, I was naive to think that the memoria would be safe in my former quarters, even once they were rendered inaccessible to mortal interlopers.

TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_024<tab>Sin eaters must have been drawn to the memoria's concentrated Darkness. They would have provided enough Light to break the seal─and suitable fodder for the fiend in its newfound freedom.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_025<tab>In sparing the First from its wrath, you have prevented untold devastation.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_026<tab>I know that words will not absolve me. Yet, as one who draws breath upon this star, I offer them nonetheless.
TEXT_KINGDD104_05408_CYELLA_000_027<tab>Warrior of Darkness... Nay, Warrior of Light. I thank you.
